H0.text: -10°C is the temperature at which the second container of 90 mL water freezes, whereas the first container of 100 mL water freezes at 0 °C.

H1.text: -1°C is the temperature at which the second container, holding 90 mL of water, freezes, while the first container with 100 mL of water freezes at 0 °C in a freezer.

H2.text: 0°C is the temperature at which the second container of 90 mL of water freezes when placed in a freezer, because the water in the container freezes at 0 °C.

H3.text: 10°C is the temperature at which the second container of 90 mL of water freezes when placed in a second freezer, while the first container of 100 mL of water freezes at 0°C.

A4.text: The melting point of ice is 0 °C (32 °F; 273 K) at standard pressure
